thread.title: Speakers confirmed for the Master Innholders General Managers’ Conference 2016
thread.title_full: Speakers confirmed for the Master Innholders General Managers’ Conference 2016

author: mich@girlracer.me.uk (Michelle Chenery)
title: Speakers confirmed for the Master Innholders General Managers’ Conference 2016
text:
Speakers confirmed for the Master Innholders General Managers’ Conference 2016 Speakers confirmed for the Master Innholders General Managers’ Conference 2016 Details Category: Venues & Events Created on Friday, 10 July 2015 11:00 The first wave of speakers have been confirmed for the Master Innholders 23rd General Managers’ Conference taking place 11-12 January 2016 at Grosvenor House, London, a JW Marriott Hotel. Launching this year’s theme ‘Excellence is No Coincidence’, conference chairman Stuart Bowery said he is delighted to be hosting the event: “I have the support of an organising committee that will attract speakers and supplier sponsors to inspire hoteliers and hospitality managers for their own personal learning and development. 
“The conference title is ‘Excellence is No Coincidence’ and reflects the Master Innholders remit in striving to uphold excellence within the art of hospitality. Delivering excellence is behaviour and a habit, not a coincidence. The General Managers’ Conference attracts attendees who operate the finest hotels in the UK and beyond.” Confirmed headline speaker Luke Johnson, will inspire the audience on business success as a leading British serial entrepreneur. One of Europe’s top leadership experts, Steve Radcliffe, will be opening the conference with thought-provoking insights on creating a mindset that delivers extraordinary results. Well known for his no-nonsense approach, Steve has provided leadership coaching to over 50 chief executives, heads of the Civil Service, the NHS and the other government departments. Other confirmed speakers include Robbie Bargh of Gorgeous Group, digital expert Dan Christian, Wayne Clarke founding partner of Global Growth, as well as internationally recognised behaviour expert Jez Rose.
